comment.author: 43854658@N00
comment._content: From Wikipedia: "Arthur M. Prentiss was an American photographer born c. 1865 and died c. 1940. Some of his photos are part of the Farm Security Administration - Office of War Information Collection held in the Library Of Congress and most of his work was developed in Oregon." He published a collection of photographs in 1918 titled, "Spruce helped win the war: a portrayal of the personnel, railroad construction, timber cutting and shipping, camp life and kindred subjects necessary to the production of airplane spruce in unlimited quantities for the United States and her allies." At the time Prentiss was the official photographer for the Warren Spruce Company and Grant Smith-Porter Brothers.
